attributes.comment:
We are writing to comment on the proposed fee increases for processing USCIS
immigration and naturalization forms/documents. Fee increases are fine if that is
what is needed to process and complete documents in a more timely and cost
effective manner. However, as US citizens currently in the process of an
international adoption we are disappointed to see this proposal. International
adoption is a very expensive endeavor in and of itself. What disappoints us most
is the fact that many adoptive families must redo fingerprints and re-apply for other
forms/documents (ex. I-171) because they expire at 15 and 18 months. If this fee
increase is absolutely necessary, would it at least be possible to extend the
times that the current forms are valid so that families would not have to pay these
fees multiple times? If not,we ask that you take more time to consider this
increase and how it will not only affect adoptive families, but also immigrants and
others utilizing your services.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Lappe Family
